holidays.name: Hat Day
holidays.description: A day to don your quirkiest, funniest, or fanciest hat and show it off to the world! Whether it's a top hat, a beanie with a pompom, or something completely bizarre, today is your excuse to top off your outfit with flair.
holidays.origin: Hat Day gained popularity as a whimsical celebration encouraging people to have fun with their headwear, often organized by communities and hat enthusiasts worldwide.
holidays.funFact: In the Victorian era, hats were so important that a well-chosen hat could instantly reveal a person's social status!

holidays.name: Strawberry Ice Cream Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the sweet, creamy delight of strawberry ice cream today! Whether you prefer scoops in a cone or swirls in a sundae, this day honors one of the most beloved ice cream flavors ever.
holidays.origin: Ice cream lovers created this unofficial holiday to honor their favorite fruity flavor, especially popular in the United States during winter as a cheerful treat.
holidays.funFact: The first strawberry ice cream recipe dates back to 1744 and was featured in French culinary texts!

holidays.name: Bean Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration dedicated to beans of all kinds! From baked beans to green beans, this holiday highlights the humble legume and its importance in cuisines around the world.
holidays.origin: Bean Day was established by the National Bean Advocate to promote eating beans for their health and environmental benefits.
holidays.funFact: Beans are one of the oldest cultivated plants and can fix nitrogen in the soil, making them great for sustainable farming!

holidays.name: National Appreciate a Dragon Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day to celebrate dragons, those mythical, fire-breathing creatures that have captured human imagination for centuries. Dress up, read dragon tales, or watch dragon-themed movies!
holidays.origin: This unofficial modern holiday was created by fantasy fans to honor dragons in popular culture and folklore.
holidays.funFact: Dragons appear in the myths of over 50 different cultures worldwide, each with their own unique twist!
